Key Match Events: The Golden State Warriors used a first quarter explosion to beat the Philadelphia 76ers 139-105.
Stephen Curry made 8/8 three-pointers and scored 30 points with 10 assists.
Post-Match Reflections: The Sixers must respond on Saturday night when they play the Brooklyn Nets.
Philly must win the rebounding battle and limit their turnovers against a desperate Brooklyn squad.
Getting Paul George going early in this contest should add another dimension to Philly's offensive and defensive schemes.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sixers perimeter defense left a lot to be desired, on multiple occasions throughout this contest they would let a Warrior go straight to the basket for an easy lay-up.
Philly is clearly missing Kelly Oubre Jr's tenacity on both sides of the ball.
Others: The Sixers will have two full days to prepare for the Nets and finally play on equal footing with an opponent.
